net.sf.mmm.util.serialization.api

Interface Serializer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JavaSerializer

    @ComponentSpecification
public interface Serializer
    This is the interface to serialize and deserialize arbitrary Java objects. As a default implementation we offer JavaSerializer but there can be many alternative implementations like JSon, GWT RPC, etc.
    The call deserialize(serialize(o)) should have behave like creating a deep-clone.

    ATTENTION:
    Not all objects can be serialized. By default they have to be compliant with Serializable. However, specific implementations may have additional or alternate requirements. E.g. for GWT (Google Web Toolkit) the object has to have a non-arg constructor (may be protected) and shall not have final fields.
    Since:
    5.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object deserialize(byte[] data)
      De-serializes (or un-marshals) the given serialized data back to the corresponding Object.
      byte[] serialize(Object object)
      Serializes (or marshals) the given Object to serialized data.

    • Method Detail

      • serialize

        byte[] serialize(Object object)
        Serializes (or marshals) the given Object to serialized data.
        Parameters:
        object - is the Object to serialize. May be null.
        Returns:
        the serialized data (payload) representing the given Object. We use byte[] to allow arbitrary data including any binary format. However, this can also be a String encoded e.g. in UTF-8.

      • deserialize

        Object deserialize(byte[] data)
        De-serializes (or un-marshals) the given serialized data back to the corresponding Object.
        Parameters:
        data - is the serialized data.
        Returns:
        the
